Starts as a very simple rom com , meet cute and developing relationship, but descends into a drug fuelled farce , not sure exactly what message it’s trying to get out there but it’s not a message I endorse . An intelligent female Secretary of State descends into the state of an adolescent idiocy when she hooks up with an old friend and starts living the misspent youth she never had , thereby jeopardising her chances of becoming the next president , not sure exactly what the audience is meant to extrapolate from that , but this audience member didn’t like it at all , is the message women will do anything for a relationship, they are so desperate for affection ? Because that’s the only “ meaning “ I could find , oh and by the way it gets pretty gross at times too . No wonder this bombed , despite an excellent cast .

"Long Shot" is the perfect mix of humour and heart making it an ideal way to wind down your Thursday. Theron is effortlessly classy and gorgeous as the Secretary of State, while Rogen, in his usual hilariously unfiltered style, delivers a performance that's both relatable and genuinely funny. His humor feels natural, making every scene he's in a thrill to watch.

While the story doesn't reinvent the genre, its charm lies in depicting two wildly different characters, one polished - the other chaotic, finding common ground.

The film has beautiful visuals that take you around the world and brisk pacing that keeps it engaging. An unexpected action sequence midway adds an energetic twist, while the nostalgic tone brings heart to the comedy, grounding the film in genuine emotions. "Long Shot" is sweet, witty, and effortlessly entertaining.
